doc.field:
This layer contains data for those parts of the sewer interceptor system in the Twin Cities metropolitan area that have been removed from service (but not removed from the ground)
The interceptor system provides the link from community sewer systems to the wastewater treatment facilities in the seven county metropolitan area.

<?xml version="1.0"?><metadata> <idinfo> <citation> <citeinfo> <origin>Metropolitan Council</origin> <pubdate>Periodically revised</pubdate> <title>Abandoned Sewer Interceptors</title> <mgmg1cid>N/A</mgmg1cid> <pubinfo> <publish>Metropolitan Council</publish> </pubinfo> <onlink>ftp://gisftp.metc.state.mn.us/AbandonedInterceptors.zip</onlink> </citeinfo> </citation> <descript> <abstract>This layer contains data for those parts of the sewer interceptor system in the Twin Cities metropolitan area that have been removed from service (but not removed from the ground)
The interceptor system provides the link from community sewer systems to the wastewater treatment facilities in the seven county metropolitan area.</abstract> <purpose>To provide a digital inventory of Metropolitan Council, Environmental Services division abandoned pipelines.</purpose> <supplinf>Twin Cities 7 County Metropolitan Area. This includes the counties of Anoka, Carver, Dakota, Hennepin, Ramsey, Scott and Washington in Minnesota.</supplinf> </descript> <timeperd> <timeinfo> <sngdate> <caldate>20120601</caldate> </sngdate> </timeinfo> <current>dataset is up-to-date as of specified date.</current> </timeperd> <status> <progress>Complete</progress> <update>As Needed</update> </status> <spdom> <bounding> <crossref> <citeinfo> <title>Sewer Interceptors, Sewer Interceptor Lift Stations, Sewer Interceptor Meter Stations</title> </citeinfo> </crossref> <ptcontac> <cntinfo> <cntperp> <cntorg>Metropolitan Council</cntorg> <cntper>Tim Leach</cntper> </cntperp> <cntpos>Environmental Services Division</cntpos> <cntaddr> <addrtype> mailing and physical address </addrtype> <address>390 Robert Street North</address> <city>St. Paul</city> <state>Minnesota</state> <postal>55101-1805</postal> </cntaddr> <cntvoice>651-602-1063</cntvoice> <cntfax>651-602-1030</cntfax> <cntemail>tim.leach@metc.state.mn.us</cntemail> </cntinfo> </ptcontac> </idinfo> <dataqual> <logic>The dataset is topologically 'clean'.</logic> <complete>Between 1970 (formation of Sewer Board) and 1990 (formation of ES GIS) several interceptors were abandoned or reconveyed and were not included in the original GIS inventory. This dataset is incomplete and should not be used as a definative system.</complete> <posacc> <horizpa> <horizpar>The positional accuracy of the dataset has not been tested under the National Standards for Spatial Data Accuracy. The positional accuracy of the dataset is estimated to be 20 ft.</horizpar> </horizpa> </posacc> <lineage> <srcinfo> <srcscale /> </srcinfo> <procstep> <procdesc>This dataset was derived from as-built plan drawings. The data were transferred to ETAK street base files and later converted to match a 1992 (?) Minnesota Department of Transportation street base.
The Metropolitan Council is in the process of developing parallel data using GPS locations for more accurate positioning.</procdesc> </procstep> </lineage> </dataqual>
<spref> <horizsys> <geograph /> <geodetic> <horizdn>NAD83</horizdn> <ellips>GRS80</ellips> </geodetic> </horizsys> <vertdef> <altsys /> <depthsys /> </vertdef> </spref> <eainfo> <overview> <eaover>LINE ATTRIBUTES
ID-NO: Text identifier of interceptor
PIPE-SHAPE: Pipe shape (circular, horseshoe, etc.)
PIPE-TYPE: Pipe material
X-INCH: Pipe dimension value (x-axis inches)
Y-INCH: Pipe dimension value (y-axis inches)
LENGTH_FT: Point-to-point section length (feet)
SYMBOL: 1 = gravity, 2 = force main, 3 = siphon, 4 = outfall, 5 = low-head, 6 = non-MCES pipe connecting remote MCES point to interceptors, 8 = bypass
SURF-TYPE: Surface type (bituminous, gravel, ground, etc.)
YR-BUILT: Year constructed
PROJECT: Construction project nomenclature
ALTER-ID: Alternate name
LS-NO: Associated Lift Station Number (Forcemain only)
NOTES: Notes
INTERCEPT: Numeric ID for interceptor
SECTION: Hydraulic section ID (obsolete)
SECT_ID: Section ID based on downstream point-to-point
INT-SECT: Unique relate field based on INTERCEPT and SECT_ID
DIMEN: Text version of pipe dimension
WWTP: Treatment plant to which interceptor flows
BASIN: MCES defined treatment plant shed
METER: Flow meter to which the pipe is tributary
FROMPNT: UNIQUE_ID at upstream end of section
TOPNT: UNIQUE_ID at downstream end of section
MEAS_BEG: Linear location of INT_SECT beginning
MEAS_END: Linear location of INT_SECT ending
YR_INSP: Year last inspected (semi-populated)
MO_INSP: Month last inspected (semi-populated)
YR_ABAN: Year abandoned or reconveyed </eaover> <eadetcit>None</eadetcit> </overview> </eainfo> <distinfo> <resdesc>AbandonedInterceptors</resdesc> <distliab>NOTICE The Geographic Information System (GIS) Data to which this notice is attached are made available pursuant to the Minnesota Government Data Practices Act (Minnesota Statutes Chapter 13). THE GIS DATA ARE PROVIDED TO YOU AS IS AND WITHOUT ANY WARRANTY AS TO THEIR PERFORMANCE, MERCHANTABILITY, OR FITNESS FOR ANY PARTICULAR PURPOSE. The GIS Data were developed by the Metropolitan Council for its own internal business purposes. The Metropolitan Council does not represent or warrant that the GIS Data or the data documentation are error-free, complete, current, or accurate. You are responsible for any consequences resulting from your use of the GIS Data or your reliance on the GIS Data. You should consult the data documentation for this particular GIS Data to determine the limitations of the GIS Data and the precision with which the GIS Data may depict distance, direction, location, or other geographic features. If you transmit or provide the GIS Data (or any portion of it) to another user, it is recommended that the GIS Data include a copy of this disclaimer and this metadata.</distliab> <stdorder> <digform> <digtinfo> <formname>ArcView Shape files</formname> <formvern>ArcGIS 9x</formvern> <transize>0.1 meg. for ZIP file.</transize> </digtinfo> </digform> <ordering>This dataset is distributed on the internet by clicking below after 'Online Linkage'. Doing so will tell your browser to download a 'ZIP' file which will contain the following:
- ArcView shape files - metadata for the dataset (.htm) - NOTICE.RTF, an important notice about this dataset that can be read by any word processing software.
Additionally, this dataset is available for direct use via one or more map services. More information about what a web mapping service is can be found at http://www.datafinder.org/services/. The specific map service and layer name for this dataset can be found by clicking the blue or green boxes under the map service column of the DataFinder Catalog at http://www.datafinder.org/catalog/ .</ordering> </stdorder> <distrib> <cntinfo> <cntperp> <cntorg>Metropolitan Council</cntorg> <cntper>Tim Leach</cntper> </cntperp> <cntpos>GIS Database Administrator</cntpos> <cntaddr> <addrtype> mailing and physical address </addrtype> <address>390 Robert Street North</address> <city>St. Paul</city> <state>Minnesota</state> <postal>55101-1805</postal> </cntaddr> <cntvoice>651-602-1063</cntvoice> <cntfax>651-602-1083</cntfax> <cntemail>tim.leach@metc.state.mn.us</cntemail> </cntinfo> </distrib> </distinfo> <metainfo> <metd>20120604</metd> <metstdn>Minnesota Geographic Metadata Guidelines</metstdn> <metstdv>1.2</metstdv> <metextns> <onlink>http://www.gis.state.mn.us/stds/metadata.htm</onlink> </metextns> <metc> <cntinfo> <cntperp> <cntorg>Metropolitan Council</cntorg> <cntper>Tim Leach</cntper> </cntperp> <cntpos>Environmental Services Division</cntpos> <cntaddr> <addrtype> mailing and physical address </addrtype> <address>390 Robert Street North</address> <city>St. Paul</city> <state>Minnesota</state> <postal>55101-1805</postal> </cntaddr> <cntvoice>651-602-1063</cntvoice> <cntfax>651-602-1083</cntfax> <cntemail>timothy.leach@metc.state.mn.us</cntemail> </cntinfo> </metc> </metainfo> </metadata>
